intro: Pterostemma benzingii, commonly known as the Benzing's pterostemma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
